dismissalComment.html: Sehwag is having a ball with the ball! Another regulation offie outside off, and Shafiul sweeps without much idea, across the line. Raps him on the pads, he is a little forward of the stumps, so umpire Doctrove thinks long and hard but eventually gives him.

headshotImage.caption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: almost saw it coming. Sehwag looked as menacing as Malinga did last night, and Rasel was shivering when the genius of part-time off spin dawdled in and landed one from round the sticks on off stump. There was some flight, no spin, no pace, but he played all around it and it found its way to the furniture.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: ah! With Ashraful, you know the brain freeze is just around the corner, and here it is. Having played watchfully all along, one boundary has brought the impetuosity back. He goes for an ill-advised hoick off a short of length ball on leg stump. It was there to be hit, yes, but that was not the right shot. It ballooned off the top edge, high over square leg, but Praveen Kumar stayed put and took a nicely judged catch near the rope

dismissalComment.html: aaaaand gone! Praveen persists with the 'Hit me' length ball outside off, Tamim goes for it again, driving uppishly, but could not find the gap. Raina takes a nice tumbling catch at cover, and India have redeemed a start that was rapidly going away from them. Praveen looks angry.. He always does! Whaddaplaya!

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Harbhajan Singh 7 (7b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Beauty! Harbhajan has OWNED Shakib with the perfect straighter one. It was tossed up again, Shakib got forward, but was a fraction short of the pitch of the ball. He could not smother the lack of spin, as it darted in through the bat-pad gap to knock the pegs. Class. It was intended as an offie, but it did not turn away.

dismissalText.commentary: Gautam Gambhir lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 82 (101b 6x4 0x6 129m) SR: 81.18

dismissalComment.html: and he's removed Gambhir straight away. He never looked at ease against the fast bowlers, got some runs against the spinners, but still needs some confidence ahead of tougher challenges. This one was a length ball on middle stump and rapped Gambhir, hanging in the crease, in front of middle and leg. He was quite late coming down on it, and it would have taken out middle.

dismissalComment.html: lovely bit of bowling from Shakib! Flight outside off and turn, luring Kohli forward and breaking past his off stump. His back foot strayed out of the crease and he could not get back entirely in time. Toes on the line, bails in the air. Third umpire takes a few close looks at it and says Kohli is out.

headshotImage.caption: RG Sharma headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone first ball! All those talks of bonus points can stop for a while, since Shakib is creating a chance for Bangladesh here. Arm ball speared in on off and heading straight for leg. Rohit makes a lazy forward lunge with bat tucked behind the pad and it hits him flush in front of middle. The umpire thinks it through and rules him out. Well!

commentTextItems.html: and that's the end of that. Dhoni seals it with a neat little flick off the back foot, behind square leg and India have won easily, despite looking unconvincing all day.

commentPostTextItems.html: Handshakes all around. A rather bizarre game this. Bangladesh looked the part in the first ten overs or so of their innings, with India's seamers looking distinctly below par. Incredibly Bangladesh did not take a single in that period. Nehra struck with a couple of poor deliveries, and Zaheer kept improving, but it was the spinners who stifled Bangladesh. And then Sehwag came on and blew them away.

India's top order looked rusty - even Gambhir who made runs. Worries for Kohli and Sharma, who let by a good chance to assess the conditions. It won't get any easier against Shoaib, Malinga and co. Dhoni looked solid as always, and in the end, they still won comfortably.
Sanjay: "Dhoni has had his 38th not out innings with a score of 38 not out! no wonder his average is so good." After all, it is the average that distinguishes a good batsman from an average one!

Shakib: "Losing all those wickets in the end was the turning point. Batting was not that difficult on this pitch. After a long time the fast bowlers did well, and that's good for them. We are up for the remaining games."

MS Dhoni: "WELL OF COURSE, if you see most of the senior players they did well, most of them bowled really well. As the game progressed it became really difficult. Good that we batted for half an hour before the break. Spinners won it for us. It is 200% difficult to bat under lights here (commenting on the low lights). Gautam provided a decent start. When he gets a start he normally goes on to get a big one. It is always good to get a bonus point if we can."

Man of the Match - Gautam Gambhir "It was only at the T20 World Cup that I did not do well, there has been a lot of talk about my form. This was a perfect pitch for me to come back on. It was a wicket where you had to graft. If Bangladesh had got 240-260 it would have been difficult. After the start they got we did not think we could keep them down to 160. All the bowlers did well."

Interesting there, Dhoni's comment on batting under lights. Even Malinga mentioned the same yesterday, with Afridi ,missing a couple of balls during the chase. I wonder if it will have a prt to play in the tournament.
On that note, it is time for us to end our coverage of the game. Hope you enjoyed it as much as we enjoyed bringing it to you. On behalf of Cricinfo, this is Nitin Sundar signing off. Bye!

commentTextItems.html: Dhoni has had enough. Now that he's forced the field to come in thanks to the Powerplay, he just whacks the length ball hard and high enough to clear cover - only just. It burst through the hands of the jumping fielder and still made it to the cover fence
worked away off the hips by Raina to get off the mark
much like he did in his first spell, he follows up a good ball with a wide down the leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

commentTextItems.html: nicely played. Presses forward, rocks back and then creams it between mid off and cover for a couple
works him with the spin into the off side for a single
Dhoni thinks of leaping out again, but resists the temptation and plays it away from the crease
works this to the left of the bowler for another single
the urgency rubs off on Gambhir who lets rip a smooth cover drive, getting to the pitch, hitting against the spin with minimum fuss along the ground
he's had his adventure for the over, just defends sedately down the track this time

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Gautam Gambhir player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Gautam Gambhir player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

commentTextItems.html: Whump! That's what we want to see Dhoni do when he comes down the track, go through with the full swing and send it flying straight. He was not to the pitch this time, and it was well outside his off stump, so he fore-handed it with disdain into the night.
Dhoni leaps out full of intent and dead-bats it, again.
defended down the pitch from leg stump line

commentPreTextItems.html: Bangladesh for obvious reasons have not taken the Bowling Powerplay and India for some reason, are not taking the batting Powerplay either. Still, a bonus point seems a formality.. that despite India being distinctly off colour today. 26 required in 12 overs for the bonus point.

While the players take a drinks break. s the FIFA World Cup moves into its sixth day, check out ESPN Soccernet for the latest news, reports and match action. And check out the Destination SA diary for views on vuvuzelas and the bitter cold from our writers in South Africa, including Cricinfo's Jayaditya Gupta and Firdose Moonda.

commentTextItems.html: nudged off the pads, with the spin into the leg side. I should copy this somewhere ready to paste. They have done it too often today.
finally a shot in anger, cut away powerfully to the left of point, but it slows up as it nears the boundary

dismissalComment.html: ah! With Ashraful, you know the brain freeze is just around the corner, and here it is. Having played watchfully all along, one boundary has brought the impetuosity back. dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Harbhajan Singh 7 (7b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Beauty! Harbhajan has OWNED Shakib with the perfect straighter one. It was tossed up again, Shakib got forward, but was a fraction short of the pitch of the ball. He could not smother the lack of spin, as it darted in through the bat-pad gap to knock the pegs. Class. It was intended as an offie, but it did not turn away.

dismissalText.commentary: Syed Rasel b Sehwag 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: almost saw it coming. Sehwag looked as menacing as Malinga did last night, and Rasel was shivering when the genius of part-time off spin dawdled in and landed one from round the sticks on off stump. There was some flight, no spin, no pace, but he played all around it and it found its way to the furniture.

He never looked at ease against the fast bowlers, got some runs against the spinners, but still needs some confidence ahead of tougher challenges. This one was a length ball on middle stump and rapped Gambhir, hanging in the crease, in front of middle and leg. He was quite late coming down on it, and it would have taken out middle.

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 11 (22b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: lovely bit of bowling from Shakib! Flight outside off and turn, luring Kohli forward and breaking past his off stump. His back foot strayed out of the crease and he could not get back entirely in time. Toes on the line, bails in the air. Third umpire takes a few close looks at it and says Kohli is out.

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone first ball! All those talks of bonus points can stop for a while, since Shakib is creating a chance for Bangladesh here.
